subject: Golf
lead_paragraph: Mark O’Meara roared into position for his first Champions Tour victory, matching the Cap Cana Championship scoring record with a seven-under 65 in the second round in the Dominican Republic. Eduardo Romero and Keith Fergus joined O’Meara atop the leader board at eight-under 136. ¶Jiyai Shin moved into position for her second LPGA Tour victory of the year and fifth in eight months, shooting a six-under 66 to take a one-stroke lead after the third round of the J Golf Phoenix LPGA International. lpga (AP).
